com.opendxl.client

Class Broker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opendxl.client.Broker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Broker>

    public class Broker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Broker>, java.lang.Cloneable
    The class Broker represents a DXL message broker.

    Instances of this class are created for the purpose of connecting to the DXL fabric.

    There are a couple of ways to create Broker instances:

    • Invoking the Broker constructor directly
    • When creating a DxlClientConfig object via the DxlClientConfig.createDxlConfigFromFile(java.lang.String) static method

    • Constructor Detail

      • Broker

        public Broker(java.lang.String uniqueId,
              int port,
              java.lang.String hostName,
              java.lang.String ipAddress)
        Constructor for the Broker
        Parameters:
        uniqueId - A unique identifier for the broker, used to identify the broker in log messages, etc.
        port - The port of the broker
        hostName - The host name or IP address of the broker (required)
        ipAddress - A valid IP address for the broker. This allows for both the host name and IP address to be used when connecting to the broker (optional).

      • Broker

        public Broker(java.lang.String uniqueId,
              int port,
              java.lang.String hostName,
              java.lang.String ipAddress,
              boolean useWebSockets)
        Constructor for the Broker
        Parameters:
        uniqueId - A unique identifier for the broker, used to identify the broker in log messages, etc.
        port - The port of the broker
        hostName - The host name or IP address of the broker (required)
        ipAddress - A valid IP address for the broker. This allows for both the host name and IP address to be used when connecting to the broker (optional).
        useWebSockets - Whether to use WebSockets or regular MQTT over tcp when connecting to a broker

      • parse

        public static Broker parse(java.lang.String configString)
                    throws MalformedBrokerException
        Constructs and returns a Broker for the specified configuration string of the following format:

        [UniqueId];[Port];[HostName];[IpAddress]

        Parameters:
        configString - The configuration string
        Returns:
        A Broker corresponding to the specified configuration string
        Throws:
        MalformedBrokerException - If the format is malformed

      • parse

        public static Broker parse(java.lang.String configString,
                           java.lang.String protocol)
                    throws MalformedBrokerException
        Constructs and returns a Broker for the specified protocol and configuration string of the following format:

        [UniqueId];[Port];[HostName];[IpAddress]

        Parameters:
        configString - The configuration string
        protocol - The protocol to use when connecting to a broker
        Returns:
        A Broker corresponding to the specified configuration string and protocol
        Throws:
        MalformedBrokerException - If the format is malformed

      • parse

        public static Broker parse(java.lang.String configString,
                           boolean useWebSockets)
                    throws MalformedBrokerException
        Constructs and returns a Broker for the specified configuration string of the following format:

        [UniqueId];[Port];[HostName];[IpAddress]

        Parameters:
        configString - The configuration string
        useWebSockets - Whether to use WebSockets or regular MQTT over tcp when connecting to a broker
        Returns:
        A Broker corresponding to the specified configuration string
        Throws:
        MalformedBrokerException - If the format is malformed
